alert.note: Alert for Forrest (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 18 at 7:43AM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Forrest County through 815 AM CDT... At 743 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Lumberton, or 11 miles northeast of Poplarville, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Rock Hill and Maxie around 755 AM CDT. Brooklyn around 800 AM CDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 AM CDT for southeastern Mississippi.
